Curious as to “what the word Brio means?” or what our most popular dishes are? We have the answers to your FAQs (Frequently Asked Questions) about Brio Italian restaurant and your favorite Italian food! If we did not answer your question, please visit the Contact Us FAQs. Contact Us FAQs How May I Provide Feedback? We’d love to hear from you. Please send us your feedback with the Contact Us Form . How Do I Contact Brio Italian Media Department? Thank you for your interest in Brio Italian Grille and our contemporary Italian food. Please email our media department at [email protected] . FAQs About Brio What Does Brio Mean? In Italian, the word brio means “lively or joyful.” And from the robust flavors to the welcoming setting, Brio Italian Grille is just that! Brio’s villa-like interior will transport you to Tuscany with its hand-crafted Italian mosaics, Venetian plaster walls and arches, soaring ceilings, and fine marble countertops. The Brio menu features premium steaks, homemade pasta, fresh seafood, and crispy flatbreads prepared in an authentic Italian wood-burning oven. Tell Me About Brio Italian Restaurant Brio Italian Grille is upscale affordable dining at its best, with chef-driven Italian food and an inviting atmosphere under a fun, family-friendly Roman ruin decor. We believe “To eat well is to live well”. Join us after work for weekday Happy Hours, Martini Wednesday with the girls, Wine Thursday for a perfect date night, or our can’t miss Sunday Brunch. From our Grilled Chicken Marsala to our Pasta Brio, and steaks cooked in our wood-burning oven, our Tuscan-inspired Italian restaurant menu is sure to satisfy. Gather with friends, family, and co-workers to experience the flavors of Italy without leaving the country. Use our Locations page to find your local Brio Italian Restaurant and join us for a great Italian meal. We’re open seven days a week, offering lunch & dinner, corporate and event catering, and private group dining. If you prefer to enjoy Brio at home or office, easily order online for take out, curbside pick up and delivery. Learn more About Brio Italian Grille here.  Buon Appetito! Who Owns Brio Italian Restaurant? Brio Italian Grille is owned and operated by Earl Enterprises , a recognized leader in the hospitality industry for over 30 years, building innovative, sustainable brands that guests can enjoy today and in the future. FaqS ABOUT BRIO ITALIAN EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES I Am Interested In Working For Brio Italian Grille, How Can I Apply? Thank you for your interest in joining the Brio Italian Grille team. Please review available Brio employment opportunities for Restaurant Management and Hourly Team Member positions and APPLY FOR CAREERS ONLINE  by clicking here. If you want to apply in person for a part-time or hourly position visit our locations page to find your nearest Brio Italian restaurant. Gift Card FAQs How Can I Purchase A Gift Card? Everyone loves the gift of scratch-made Italian food from Brio Italian Grille. Our gift cards may be purchased at your local restaurant or on the Brio website. Check out our new eGift cards on our website. Now you can email friends and family Brio gift cards. You can also find Brio gift cards at many fine retailers, like CVS, Walmart, Cumberland Farms, and BJ’s Wholesale. How Can I Check The Balance Of My Gift Card? Visit our Brio Gift Cards page to check your gift card balance online. BRIO ITALIAN Specials FAQs Does Brio Italian Have Specials? There is always something special happening at your local Brio Italian Grille location. Current Italian food dine in and to go Brio specials can be found online and on our menu page here. BRIO ITALIAN TO GO & DELIVERY FAQs Does Brio Italian Deliver? Yes, most of our locations deliver our contemporary Italian food to their surrounding areas. Check our Locations page to find a Brio Italian Restaurant near you. Enter your address in our Order Now page to see if we deliver our fresh salads, Italian flatbreads, and upscale pastas to your neighborhood. Curbside pickup is also available. Does Brio Italian Offer Takeout? Yes, if you’re craving great pastas, flatbreads, salads, and contemporary Italian food to go, all Brio locations offer takeout. Order Now and select curbside pickup. BRIO ITALIAN GRILLE RESERVATIONS FAQs Does Brio Take Reservations? Yes, Brio accepts reservations! Easily reserve your table online by visiting our RESERVATIONS page. For parties of 20 or more, book your GROUP DINING event online or call our Event Planners at your local Brio LOCATIONS to make your large group reservation. BRIO ITALIAN GRILLE LOCATIONS FAQs Where Is Brio Italian Grille Located? Brio headquarters is located in Orlando, Florida and operates many locations across the United States. Visit our Locations directory to find a Brio Italian Restaurant near you. When Are You Opening A Brio In My Hometown? Brio plans to continue to grow our concept. We are always looking for great new locations to share our contemporary Italian food. Contact us and let us know where we should open next! When Is Brio Italian Grille Open? Brio is open 7 days a week, including most major holidays. Check our Locations directory to find a Brio Italian Restaurant near you and view operating and special holiday hours. Nutritional Information FAQs What Is The Nutritional Information For The Brio Menu? Find Brio Italian MENU NUTRITIONALS for our contemporary Italian food on our regular and catering menu. Where Can I Find The Allergen Information For Brio’s Menu? Find Brio MENU ALLERGEN INFORMATION here . If you’re looking for Brio’s Italian food nutritional information, you can view our nutritional information as well. Do you have a food allergy question? CONTACT US HERE Does Brio Have A Gluten Free Menu? At Brio Italian Grille, we strive to be mindful of a variety of dietary restrictions, including gluten sensitivities. Please click here to find our BRIO GLUTEN SENSITIVE Italian food menu. Steve Layt CEO FoodFirst Global Restaurants, parent to Brio Tuscan Grille and Bravo Cucina Italiana, names Steve Layt CEO The restaurant industry veteran replaces Brad Blum as FoodFirst plans to reposition both casual dining brands Nancy Luna , Senior editor, Nation's Restaurant News January 28, 2020 2 Min Read FoodFirst Global Restaurants, the parent company of Brio Tuscan Grille and Bravo Cucina Italiana, has named Steve Layt as the company’s new chief executive officer. The change is effective immediately, as former CEO and FoodFirst founder Brad Blum has stepped down from his role as chairman and chief executive, the Columbus, Ohio-based company said in a statement released Tuesday morning. The company said Blum will remain an owner-partner as the company plans to reposition both casual dining brands. “I would like to personally thank Brad for his outstanding leadership and contribution in setting up the foundation for FoodFirst’s success,” Antonio Bonchristiano, CEO of GP Investments, FoodFirst’s main investor, said in a statement. Layt, left, is a 30-year restaurant veteran who previously worked as president and CEO NPC International, the nation’s largest Pizza Hut franchisee, FoodFirst said. Prior to that, he was president of Applebee’s. “We’re excited to have an operator and executive of Steve’s caliber join our team and we look forward to all we will achieve under his leadership,” Bonchristiano said in a statement. “The Board and I are confident Steve is the right leader to build on current momentum and continue to drive our operations towards industry-leading excellence.” Related: Bravo Brio’s new parent launches FoodFirst Global Restaurants Inc. FoodFirst, which formed which formed in 2018 after the brands went private earlier that year, said Layt’s “first priorities will be to deliver outstanding operational excellence” and customer service to guests. The company said it is repositioning Brio Tuscan Grille in the polished, upscale segment of casual dining. It will be called Brio Italian Mediterranean. Casual dining brand Bravo Cucina Italiana will also be repositioned and renamed Bravo Italian Mediterranean, the company said. The company provided no other details on the rebranding. She covers the industry's largest and most talked about fast-food brands including McDonald's, Starbucks, Chipotle Mexican Grill, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut, KFC and Subway. She is an award-winning journalist with more than 25 years reporting experience. As a veteran business reporter based in Southern California, Nancy has covered some of the country's most beloved food and retail brands including In-N-Out, Taco Bell, Trader Joe's, Aldi, Whole Foods Market, Target and Costco. Luna is a graduate of Cal State Fullerton. When she's not digging for news on her beat, you can find Nancy regaling her fans about her latest dining adventures on her Fast Food Maven social media channels. Contact Us FAQs How May I Provide Feedback? We’d love to hear from you. Please send us your feedback with the Contact Us Form . How Do I Contact Brio Italian Media Department? Thank you for your interest in Brio Italian Grille and our contemporary Italian food. Please email our media department at [email protected] . FAQs About Brio What Does Brio Mean? In Italian, the word brio means “lively or joyful.” And from the robust flavors to the welcoming setting, Brio Italian Grille is just that! Brio’s villa-like interior will transport you to Tuscany with its hand-crafted Italian mosaics, Venetian plaster walls and arches, soaring ceilings, and fine marble countertops. The Brio menu features premium steaks, homemade pasta, fresh seafood, and crispy flatbreads prepared in an authentic Italian wood-burning oven. Tell Me About Brio Italian Restaurant Brio Italian Grille is upscale affordable dining at its best, with chef-driven Italian food and an inviting atmosphere under a fun, family-friendly Roman ruin decor. We believe “To eat well is to live well”. Join us after work for weekday Happy Hours, Martini Wednesday with the girls, Wine Thursday for a perfect date night, or our can’t miss Sunday Brunch. From our Grilled Chicken Marsala to our Pasta Brio, and steaks cooked in our wood-burning oven, our Tuscan-inspired Italian restaurant menu is sure to satisfy. Gather with friends, family, and co-workers to experience the flavors of Italy without leaving the country. Use our Locations page to find your local Brio Italian Restaurant and join us for a great Italian meal. We’re open seven days a week, offering lunch & dinner, corporate and event catering, and private group dining. If you prefer to enjoy Brio at home or office, easily order online for take out, curbside pick up and delivery. Learn more About Brio Italian Grille here.  Buon Appetito! Who Owns Brio Italian Restaurant? Brio Italian Grille is owned and operated by Earl Enterprises , a recognized leader in the hospitality industry for over 30 years, building innovative, sustainable brands that guests can enjoy today and in the future.
